column4: is there any reason to have /vmlinuz be a link to your kernel image? update-grub keeps adding duplicates to the grub menu
yep. it's adding /vmlinuz and the real image in /boot
oh, you have a plain /boot/vmlinuz? without the version stuffs?
that's what hardy put there, apparently
Interesting.  Let me check my Hardy box.
I don't have that.  Are you sure you didn't make it by accident?  Lets see if it belongs to a package.  `dpkg -S /boot/vmlinuz` get anything?
Well, it shouldn't hurt to remove it, since it doesn't exist here, and I don't really see a good reason for it to exist anyway
You said it's in /?  or in /boot?
there was one in /, but apparently the duplicate is the link from /boot
Odd.  That shouldn't be in / for any reason.  I say remove them both.
won't the /boot link be recreated by new kernel image packages?
Oh, right.  they are.  And I have those too.  (in /)  but there shouldn't be one in /boot, and no, it won't get recreated, or shouldn't.  If it does, that package ought to lay claim to it within dpkg
What it might be is the one in /boot is misplaced from /
hmm. do you have similar links to config, initrd, and System.map?
If you're worried about it, rename it, and see if something breaks next upgrade.  No, just in /, vmlinuz and initrd.img
